messages.message:
:wave: Hey Eng!
As we’re starting our investigation into implementing *Model Context Protocol (MCP)*, one thing I want to highlight right away: *security is absolutely critical for MCP.* We need to make sure we’re building in security best practices from day one, not as an afterthought. :shield:

If you haven’t already, check out the official documentation and resources below:
• *MCP Specification:* https://modelcontextprotocol.io/specification/2025-03-26
• *Security Best Practices:* https://modelcontextprotocol.io/specification/draft/basic/security_best_practices
• *MCP Engineering Board (GitHub Project):* https://github.com/orgs/modelcontextprotocol/projects/2/views/2
The Trust team is also reaching out to Latacora for potential guidance and resources as we go.

If you have thoughts about MCP, security hardening, or ideas for how to integrate security best practices into our workflow, please share! :bulb:

More updates soon, but wanted to get this on everyone’s radar early.

Thanks all! :rocket:
@Chris
